title: Blueways, Wolfdene snap up greenfield land parcel for $60m
text:
In a sign of rising confidence in Melbourne's residential land market, a 42-hectare site in the city's north-west has changed hands for around $60 million, bought by Chinese-backed Blueways Group and its local development partner Wolfdene.

The rectangular site at 1012 Taylors Road in Fraser Rise had been on the market since February. It could support up to 500 new dwellings within the approved new suburb of Plumpton.

The Taylors Road site is just five minutes from Caroline Springs. Jason South

Major greenfield site sales in Melbourne have been few and far between in recent times as the market has dealt with a price correction and stock overhang driven by speculator-led defaults and a credit squeeze.

But with sales starting to pick up again as funding availability improves and the outlook brightens, some developers are looking to restock their land banks.

Title deeds to 1012 Taylors Road show Blueways Land No. 1 Pty Ltd, a subsidiary of Blueways Investments, recently entered into a purchase contract with the Lavecchia and Congiu families, who have owned the property since 2012.
description: Major site sales in Melbourne have been few and far between in recent times as the market has dealt with price correction.
